w3af-run.w3af-version: w3af - Web Application Attack and Audit Framework Version: 1.7.6 Revision: unknown Distribution: Kali Linux Rolling Branch: unknown Local changes: No Author: Andres Riancho and the w3af team.

vulnerability.name: Server header
vulnerability.description: The server header for the remote web server is: "Apache/2.2.15 (CentOS)".

vulnerability.name: Non existent methods default to GET
vulnerability.description: The remote Web server has a custom configuration, in which any not implemented methods that are invoked are defaulted to GET instead of returning a "Not Implemented" response.

vulnerability.name: No DNS wildcard
vulnerability.description: The target site has NO DNS wildcard, and the contents of "http://science/" differ from the contents of "http://yau-awards.science/".

header.content: no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, pre-check=0, post-check=0, max-age=0

vulnerability.name: Favicon identification failed
vulnerability.description: Favicon identification failed. If the remote site is using framework that is being exposed by its favicon, please send an email to w3af-develop@lists.sourceforge.net including this md5 hash "c4275959c367bd1314c86e90987e5f19" and the name of the server or Web application it represents. New fingerprints make this plugin more powerful and accurate.

vulnerability.name: Active filter detected
vulnerability.description: The remote network has an active filter. IMPORTANT: The result of all the other plugins will be inaccurate, web applications could be vulnerable but "protected" by the active filter.

vulnerability.name: Strange header
vulnerability.description: The remote web server sent 1 HTTP responses with the uncommon response header "x-pingback", one of the received header values is "http://www.yau-awards.science/xmlrpc.php". The first ten URLs which sent the uncommon header are: - http://yau-awards.science/

vulnerability.name: Cookie
vulnerability.description: The application sent the "wfvt_1040064600" cookie in 1 different URLs. The first ten URLs are: - http://yau-awards.science/

header.content: wfvt_1040064600=5849bd8d256d4; expires=Thu, 08-Dec-2016 20:37:41 GMT; Max-Age=1800; path=/; httponly

vulnerability.name: Strange HTTP response code
vulnerability.description: The remote web server sent 1 HTTP responses with the uncommon response status code 405 using "Method Not Allowed" as message. The first ten URLs which sent the uncommon status code are: - http://yau-awards.science/tXufJ
vulnerability.long-description: The server responded with a strange HTTP status code. This is a non-issue however exotic HTTP response status codes can provide useful insights into the behavior of the web application and assist with the information security analysis.
vulnerability.fix-guidance: Manually inspect the HTTP response status code and body

http-response.body:
Method Not Allowed

The requested method PUT is not allowed for the URL /tXufJ.

Apache/2.2.15 (CentOS) Server at yau-awards.science Port 80

vulnerability.name: Click-Jacking vulnerability
vulnerability.description: The whole target has no protection (X-Frame-Options header) against Click-Jacking attacks
vulnerability.long-description:
Clickjacking (User Interface redress attack, UI redress attack, UI redressing) is a malicious technique of tricking a Web user into clicking on something different from what the user perceives they are clicking on, thus potentially revealing confidential information or taking control of their computer while clicking on seemingly innocuous web pages.
The server didn't return an `X-Frame-Options` header which means that this website could be at risk of a clickjacking attack. The `X-Frame-Options` HTTP response header can be used to indicate whether or not a browser should be allowed to render a page inside a frame or iframe. Sites can use this to avoid clickjacking attacks, by ensuring that their content is not embedded into other sites.
vulnerability.fix-guidance: Configure your web server to include an X-Frame-Options header.
